title: Connectivity Technologies and Ecosystems Manager - Wifi
minimum_qual:

Firm understanding of Wi-Fi connectivity use cases and business models.
Firm understanding of the IEEE 802.11 family of standards, including it's evolution and latest developments.
Firm understanding of the Wi-Fi ecosystem including standard and certification bodies (IEEE, WFA...), ASIC providers, OEMs and System Integrators.
Firm understanding of relevant network and security protocols and specifications (TCP/IP, Layer-3 Routing, Layer-2 switching, user authentication, data encryption, etc).
Knowledge in any of the following areas is a plus: Android/iPhone handset networking stack, captive portal implementation, backhaul IP and optical networking, data center networking, Internet peering, content caching, virtualisation, network monitoring and remediation, telco process orchestration/automation, implementation of PaaS and SaaS services, software development, distributed systems engineering.
Ability to translate technical features into end-user use cases and identify related business opportunities.
Ability to understand Wi-Fi operator deployment scenarios for different geographies, population densities, indoor vs. outdoor, range of ARPUs and uses cases to drive development of flexible, cost-effective and open network infrastructure.
Ability to drive infrastructure hardware/software proof of concepts trials within Facebook and/or at partner labs ultimately leading to field trial evaluations prior to rapid commercial deployment.
Ability to lead partners in the development of new technical solutions, including network hardware, protocol software, user-facing interfaces and applications, network management systems, and any other critical pieces for the adoption of a complete wireless connectivity solution.
BS or higher in Telecommunications engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering or equivalent degree/experience.
Communication skills including ability to speak to technical and business audiences including C-level execs.
Fluency in English. Other languages are a plus.
Willingness and ability to travel internationally up to 35% of the time.
responsibilities:
A technical expert who questions the status quo and uses their strategic vision for the connectivity technology landscape to shape Facebook's efforts in the wireless networking domain. Ultimately they will enable infrastructure solutions with the network operator community and drive deployments across the industry at large.
Define cutting edge network deployment approaches and plan operator trials for innovative infrastructure solutions that will help deliver on the vision for wider scale telecom infrastructure adoption.
Advocate internally at Facebook, through the Telecom Infrastructure Project (TIP), and the partner community at large on how to maximise opportunities to successfully deploy new hardware and software contributions across the industry.
Manage the technical relationships with network operator and infrastructure partners to help reduce friction and remove obstacles facing networking hardware/software contribution and market adoption.
Identify key wireless networking use cases and common technical requirements from operator partners to drive design parameters within Facebook programs and the technology vendor community.
Educate the Facebook Connectivity team about how to contribute to TIP, highlight achievements/impact of contributions and share developments coming from partners.
Write white papers, blog posts and technical materials to share with the broader community with the goal to introduce and help drive adoption of TIP infrastructure.
Stay abreast of developments in the wireless networking including technology R&D, use-cases, hardware/software evolution and share that knowledge with the team.
Support the direction and expansion of the team, helping to scope future roles as the charter of the team grows.

title: Data Scientist, Analytics - Product Foundation
minimum_qual:
7+ years experience doing quantitative analysis
BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Physics, Engineering, Statistics or other technical field
Experience in SQL or other programming languages
Development experience in any scripting language (PHP, Python, Perl, etc.)
Ability to communicate the results of analyses with product and leadership teams to influence the strategy of the product
Understanding of statistics (e.g., hypothesis testing, regressions)
Experience manipulating data sets through statistical software (ex. R, SAS) or other methods
preferred_qual:
Advanced degrees
Experience with distributed computing (Hive/Hadoop)
responsibilities:
Apply your expertise in quantitative analysis, data mining, and the presentation of data to see beyond the numbers and understand how our users interact with both our consumer and business products
Partner with Product and Engineering teams to solve problems and identify trends and opportunities
Inform, influence, support, and execute our product decisions and product launches
The Data Scientist Analytics role has work across the following four areas:
Product Operations
Forecasting and setting product team goals
Designing and evaluating experiments
Monitoring key product metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics
Building and analyzing dashboards and reports
Building key data sets to empower operational and exploratory analysis
Evaluating and defining metrics
Exploratory Analysis
Proposing what to build in the next roadmap
Understanding ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends
Identifying new levers to help move key metrics
Building models of user behaviors for analysis or to power production systems
Product Leadership
Influencing product teams through presentation of data-based recommendations
Communicating state of business, experiment results, etc. to product teams
Spreading best practices to analytics and product teams
Data Infrastructure
Working in Hadoop and Hive primarily, sometimes MySQL, Oracle, and Vertica
Automating analyses and authoring pipelines via SQL and python based ETL framework

you demonstrate a consultative and analytical approach with focus on building partnerships internally and externally.

minimum_qual:

responsibilities:
Will encompass a wide spectrum of activities ranging from systemic upfront Strategic Design Planning to detailed Production Design.
Human centered in nature, this role will include user research, trend mapping, product definition, and positioning.
It will also encompass design specific activities such as inspiration, iterative concept generation, and detailed design execution through a deep understanding of user behaviors, market, manufacturing, and technology constraints.
Candidates for this role will reflect excellence in aesthetic and functional sensibilities while simultaneously addressing the various challenges presented throughout the product development process.
This role will be highly hands-on, creative, and collaborative across user research, user interaction, marketing, brand, and engineering activities.
To succeed in this role candidates will exercise the ability to think both strategically and tactically using the design tools necessary to create, communicate and execute meaningful products.

Product Operations

Monitoring key product metrics, understanding root causes of changes in metrics

Building key data sets to empower operational and exploratory analysis

Exploratory Analysis
Proposing what to build in the next roadmap
Understanding ecosystems, user behaviors, and long-term trends
Identifying new levers to help move key metrics
Building models of user behaviors for analysis or to power production systems
Product Leadership
Influencing product teams through presentation of data-based recommendations
Communicating state of business, experiment results, etc. to product teams
Spreading best practices to analytics and product teams
Data Infrastructure
Working in Hadoop and Hive primarily, sometimes MySQL, Oracle, and Vertica
Automating analyses and authoring pipelines via SQL and Python based ETL framework
